DOC.brief_title: Very Intensive Variable Repetitive AmbulatioN Training
DOC.detailed_description: The overall objective subproject evaluate individual paired contribution intensity variability step train low extremity ( LE ) function , health community participation patient chronic hemiparesis post-stroke . Using RCT design/Intervention Efficacy paradigm , Aim 1 investigate independent combine ( pair ) contribution intensity variability step train locomotor function , secondary measure health community mobility . For Aim 2 , evaluate independent combine effect intensity variability step train non-walking LE task . In Aim 3 , evaluate cost effectiveness provide intervention accelerate motor recovery health . Our central hypothesis result study provide theoretical foundation implementation physical therapy intervention facilitate short-term gain locomotor function , contribute long-term improvement health , function participation increase community mobility .
DOC.criteria: history unilateral stroke > 6 month duration walk without physical assistance speed < 1.0 m/s cardiopulmonary , metabolic , neurological orthopedic injury may contribute walk outcome
